articles.headline: Far-Right Extremist Finds an Ally in an Arizona Congressman
articles.snippet: Representative Paul Gosar’s association with the white nationalist Nick Fuentes is the most vivid example of the Republican Party’s growing acceptance of extremism.
articles.abstract: Representative Paul Gosar’s association with the white nationalist Nick Fuentes is the most vivid example of the Republican Party’s growing acceptance of extremism.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Nick Fuentes, the leader of a white nationalist group, was bemoaning the political persecution he said he was facing from the federal government when he paused during a recent livestream to praise one of his few defenders.

articles.headline: Stripped, Groped and Violated: Egyptian Women Describe Abuse by the State
articles.snippet: Speaking publicly for the first time, these Egyptian women say they were sexually abused during invasive searches and medical exams by government authorities.
articles.abstract: Speaking publicly for the first time, these Egyptian women say they were sexually abused during invasive searches and medical exams by government authorities.
articles.lead_paragraph: Speaking publicly for the first time, these Egyptian women say they were sexually abused during invasive searches and medical exams by government authorities.
articles.byline: By Mona El-Naggar, Yousur Al-Hlou and Aliza Aufrichtig

articles.headline: Tesla Says Autopilot Makes Its Cars Safer. Crash Victims Say It Kills.
articles.snippet: A California family that lost a 15-year-old boy when a Tesla hit its pickup truck is suing the company, claiming its Autopilot system was partly responsible.
articles.abstract: A California family that lost a 15-year-old boy when a Tesla hit its pickup truck is suing the company, claiming its Autopilot system was partly responsible.
articles.lead_paragraph: Benjamin Maldonado and his teenage son were driving back from a soccer tournament on a California freeway in August 2019 when a truck in front of them slowed. Mr. Maldonado flicked his turn signal and moved right. Within seconds, his Ford Explorer pickup was hit by a Tesla Model 3 that was traveling about 60 miles per hour on Autopilot.

articles.headline: How Bad Are U.S. Wildfires? Even Hawaii Is Battling a Surge.
articles.snippet: It’s among the wettest places on the planet, but shifts in rainfall, invasive grasses and a housing shortage are driving a wildfire spike on the islands.
articles.abstract: It’s among the wettest places on the planet, but shifts in rainfall, invasive grasses and a housing shortage are driving a wildfire spike on the islands.
articles.lead_paragraph: PA’AUILO, Hawaii — The blaze first swept across parched fields of guinea grass. Then the flames got so close to Emma-Lei Gerrish’s house that she feared for her life.

articles.headline: Fox’s New Channel Changes the Climate for Weather TV
articles.snippet: As viewers tune out cable news, Rupert Murdoch is preparing the debut of Fox Weather, a potentially powerful new player in a sphere long dominated by the Weather Channel.
articles.abstract: As viewers tune out cable news, Rupert Murdoch is preparing the debut of Fox Weather, a potentially powerful new player in a sphere long dominated by the Weather Channel.
articles.lead_paragraph: Weather is taking the media industry by storm.

articles.headline: They Resurrected MGM. Amazon Bought the Studio. Now What?
articles.snippet: Michael De Luca and Pamela Abdy have reinvigorated a once-storied Hollywood institution. Now it needs to figure out its place in a streaming company.
articles.abstract: Michael De Luca and Pamela Abdy have reinvigorated a once-storied Hollywood institution. Now it needs to figure out its place in a streaming company.
articles.lead_paragraph: Paul Thomas Anderson and Michael De Luca are film geeks with a shared history. As a studio executive, Mr. De Luca championed Mr. Anderson’s “Boogie Nights” and “Magnolia,” films that established the director’s reputation as a creative force. So when Focus Features said it would postpone the production of Mr. Anderson’s new film because of the pandemic, it was Mr. De Luca, in his new role as chairman of MGM’s Motion Picture Group, who swooped in and pledged to get the movie into production in Los Angeles when Mr. Anderson wanted to shoot.

articles.headline: Work at Home or the Office? Either Way, There’s a Start-Up for That.
articles.snippet: As more Americans return to an office a few days a week, start-ups providing tools for hybrid work are trying to cash in.
articles.abstract: As more Americans return to an office a few days a week, start-ups providing tools for hybrid work are trying to cash in.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Before the pandemic, Envoy, a start-up in San Francisco, sold visitor registration software for the office. Its system signed in guests and tracked who was coming into the building.

articles.headline: ‘Should We Sell?’ After Collapse, Hot Florida Market Faces Uncertainty.
articles.snippet: The partial collapse of the Champlain Towers South in Surfside, Fla., has plunged older beachside condos and high-rise buildings like it into a swirl of apprehension.
articles.abstract: The partial collapse of the Champlain Towers South in Surfside, Fla., has plunged older beachside condos and high-rise buildings like it into a swirl of apprehension.
articles.lead_paragraph: SURFSIDE, Fla. — Ines Mason bought the 14th-floor condo in a building perched on an island in Biscayne Bay five years ago as a getaway, lured by the captivating view of the water. “In the morning, the sun rises, you can see that,” she said. “It’s amazing.”
articles.byline: By Rick Rojas and Sophie Kasakove
